intro: Diascia glandulosa, commonly known as the glandular diascia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its vibrant, tubular flowers that come in shades of red, pink, and purple. The plant typically grows as a low-growing shrub, reaching heights of up to 30 centimeters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered with fine, glandular hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Diascia glandulosa is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and as a bedding plant due to its long blooming season and drought tolerance.
